channel.title: CVE Feed for HCL Software -- HCL iNotes
channel.description: The latest CVEs for HCL Software -- HCL iNotes

item.title: CVE-2022-27546|2024-08-03T05:32:59.932Z -- hcl%20software -- hcl%20inotes
item.description: HCL iNotes is susceptible to a Reflected Cross-site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability caused by improper validation of user-supplied input supplied with a form POST request. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's web browser within the security context of the hosting web site and/or steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.

item.title: CVE-2022-27547|2024-08-03T05:32:59.793Z -- hcl%20software -- hcl%20inotes
item.description: HCL iNotes is susceptible to a link to non-existent domain vulnerability. An attacker could use this vulnerability to trick a user into supplying sensitive information such as username, password, credit card number, etc.

item.title: CVE-2022-27558|2024-08-03T05:32:58.485Z -- hcl%20software -- hcl%20inotes
item.description: HCL iNotes is susceptible to a Broken Password Strength Checks vulnerability. Custom password policies are not enforced on certain iNotes forms which could allow users to set weak passwords, leading to easier cracking.
